title: Is it just me, or... Has tenacity lost its effects this patch?
body:
When i play certain champions i like to run precision for the tenacity rune. This yields 51% tenacity with mercury treads.

However, after the patch Tenacity seems to no longer work. Disable durations no longer seem to be reduced at all, even should you bump it up to 70% tenacity with an elixir or resolve's unflinching.

replies.body: As if Tenacity ever worked.

Well, it did when there was longer base CC and more "normal" CC. 25-40% off a 3 second stun is a pretty big deal. Now there are knockbacks, displacements and more which CC does zip against along with standard CC being reduced to 1-2 seconds, which means 30% off 1.5 seconds doesn't feel like anything.

WTB Tenacity buffs. It can be pretty tough to justify it sometimes, unless there's a ton of enemy Magic Damage on the team. Even then, I've still went with Tabi because it ends up cutting more total damage while I'm CC'd anyways.

Yeah Tenacity is a dead stat. It's just that thing that's kinda nice to have but noone really goes out of their way to opt into unless against a heavy "normal CC" comp.

Like, bruisers are gonna build Steraks regardless and people are gonna build Mercs vs massive magic damage comps, the Tenacity is just kinda there.
Even  against Stun comps it seems an irrelevant stat.  Just had one of those games
They should reduce the duration of all cc  that is unaffected by Tenacity.
I've noticed the same too, I usually do a full tenacity build for any support I pick; but I seem to still be in a Lux's Q for the same duration.
lux's q feels like a morgana root at level one.
It is, they have the same duration at rank 1.

I was playing vs Nasus. It had 0 effect on his W.
It speeds up the slowing so it can end faster. You’ll still feel it, but it should end sooner.
It only has effect on the last slow increment since the slow is perpetually stacking, so it can't be reduced until the last one.
Swiftness boots reduce slow severity, but it doesn't really feel all too different from treads either way. Often, you'll be better off with Tabi anyways due to the damage it will shave off his Q.

Boots of swiftness is a much better choice against Nasus. Oh thank god it's not me going crazy. just a while ago i was playing garen into Zoe. Even merc tread + timed W didn't get me out of sleepy bubble in time. Thought it was REALLY strange that cause it should be about a 75% reduction in sleep time.
Tenacity doesn't affect sleep; it's a unique form of CC

The duration of Drowsy can't be reduced, but the actual time spent asleep can be reduced. You can lower Zoe's 2 second window to land her Q down to a 1.4 second one, with just merc treads OR legend:tenacity. Both gives her less than a second to land it. Really frustrates the Zoe. Slow resist also reduces the effectiveness of the slow, but it's not really powerful enough to ever warrant getting swifties.
